snippet: New guidelines issued by the National Collegiate Athletic Association provide no mechanism for oversight or enforcement.
abstract: Editorial warns that voluntary guidelines for concussion safety released by National Collegiate Athletic Association may prove inadequate for reducing such injuries; holds that part of problem is that guidelines provide no mechanism for oversight or enforcement; suggests that organization should make guidelines mandatory in future.
lead_paragraph: New guidelines issued by the National Collegiate Athletic Association provide no mechanism for oversight or enforcement.

headline.seo: N.C.A.A. Guidelines on Head Injuries Fall Short
